org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.blockmanagement

Class BlocksMap

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.blockmanagement.BlocksMap

  •  class BlocksMap
extends Object
    This class maintains the map from a block to its metadata. block's metadata currently includes blockCollection it belongs to and the datanodes that store the block.

    • Nested Class Summary

      (package private) Iterable<DatanodeStorageInfo> getStorages(BlockInfoContiguous storedBlock)
      For a block that has already been retrieved from the BlocksMap returns Iterable of the storages the block belongs to.
      (package private) BlockInfoContiguous getStoredBlock(Block b)
      Returns the block object it it exists in the map.
      (package private) int numNodes(Block b)
      counts number of containing nodes.
      (package private) void removeBlock(Block block)
      Remove the block from the block map; remove it from all data-node lists it belongs to; and remove all data-node locations associated with the block.

      • getStorages

        Iterable<DatanodeStorageInfo> getStorages(Block b,
                                        DatanodeStorage.State state)
        Searches for the block in the BlocksMap and returns Iterable of the storages the block belongs to that are of the given state.
        Parameters:
        state - DatanodeStorage state by which to filter the returned Iterable

      • getStorages

        Iterable<DatanodeStorageInfo> getStorages(BlockInfoContiguous storedBlock)
        For a block that has already been retrieved from the BlocksMap returns Iterable of the storages the block belongs to.

      • numNodes

        int numNodes(Block b)
        counts number of containing nodes. Better than using iterator.

      • removeNode

        boolean removeNode(Block b,
                 DatanodeDescriptor node)
        Remove data-node reference from the block. Remove the block from the block map only if it does not belong to any file and data-nodes.

      • size

        int size()

      • getBlocks

        Iterable<BlockInfoContiguous> getBlocks()

      • getCapacity

        int getCapacity()
        Get the capacity of the HashMap that stores blocks

      • replaceBlock

        BlockInfoContiguous replaceBlock(BlockInfoContiguous newBlock)
        Replace a block in the block map by a new block. The new block and the old one have the same key.
        Parameters:
        newBlock - - block for replacement
        Returns:
        new block
